Package ss.pentago.tui.menu

Class TUIMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • ss.pentago.tui.menu.TUIMenu
  • public class TUIMenu
extends java.lang.Object
    TUIMenu provides a convenient way to create selection menus.
    The class is meant to be used (instantiated) this way (e.g.), where scanner should be a System.in Scanner: 
         new TUIMenu("MENU TITLE")
          .add(new TUIMenuOption("Option") {
              public void execute() {
                  // do something
              }
          })
          .add(new TUIMenuOption("Other option") {
              public void execute() {
                  // do something else
              }
          })
          .run(scanner);

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      TUIMenu​(java.lang.String title)
      Constructs a new TUIMenu with specified title.

      • TUIMenu

        public TUIMenu​(java.lang.String title)
        Constructs a new TUIMenu with specified title.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public TUIMenu add​(TUIMenuOption option)
        Add a new TUIMenuOption to this TUIMenu, ideally chain this call to the constructor.
        Parameters:
        option - the option
        Returns:
        the TUIMenu the option was added to for easy chaining

      • run

        public void run​(java.util.Scanner scanner)
        Runs the menu by showing it, requesting user input, and invoking the corresponding action. Nothing will happen if the menu has no options. As long as an invalid choice is specified, the menu will keep asking the user for input.
        Parameters:
        scanner - the System.in scanner
